item.name: 51st State
item.comment: Marek's Christmas Present 2013.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment:
Okay filler. Takes too long with 2 (one player must play for themselves and the dummy player each turn), although 2 player has more interaction (taking away cards via the dummy).
I'd much rather play Fairy Tale, since the decisions on which card to pick are more interesting. There is little incentive to take away a good card for your neighbor in 7 Wonders (except to build your wonder).

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Reason
item.comment:
Really nice streamlined rules. Still the game take forever to play. Just setting up takes a long time.
This is one that requires us to leave it on the gaming table for several evenings' play.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: A boring illogical game and a horrible simulation of farming.

item.name: Anima: Beyond Good and Evil
item.comment: Has a broken card in 2-player (can kill off a entire party). Thus the lower rating. Since we only play this 2 player, I'll have to house rule to remove the card from the game.

item.name: Anima: The Twilight of the Gods
Arena: Morituri te salutant
item.comment: Bought when I lived in the Czech Republic. I felt the Assassin was overpowered, but other than that it was a fun game of psychological dueling.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment:
I wish I had the time for this one.
This game is always a fun ride, even if you forget have a dozen rules between each play.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion
Arkham Horror: The Black Goat of the Woods Expansion
Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.wishlistcomment: Or any of the base sets.

item.name: Bang! The Dice Game: The Walking Dead
item.comment: Fun fast game that the younger kid like (and their friends).

item.name: Battlestations
item.comment: Seems very slow. You have to spend many turns building up speed, so it takes forever to get to any action. Maybe with better ships, this is not a problem.

item.name: BattleTech
item.comment:
Has the best background story and info.
I still love this game and will play willingly. However, as a parent of 3 kids, I can no longer spend an afternoon/evening just playing BT.
I would love to see a streamlined version that plays in 1/3 of the time.

item.name: Battletech Introductory Box Set
item.comment:
I have the 25th Anniversary Edition.
I was disappointed with the miniatures (except the Loki and Thor). They were slightly smaller than my metal versions, full of flash and many had poorly defined details.
Other than that, the contents are superb. The cardboard maps are really nice. All the books are slick. The cheat sheet is firm and sturdy.

item.name: Blue Moon Legends
item.comment: Marek's Christmas present 2014

item.name: Bombay Bazar
item.comment: Miles's

item.name: Brass
item.comment:
Thanks BGG Secret Santa 2012!
:-)

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: Collectible Card Game
item.comment: Marek's---I play the LCG

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
item.comment:
Even if the LCG model is better, I still can't afford to keep up. I'm a couple of years behind schedule now and will probably never buy anything else.
Still very fun to pull out every now and then.

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Ancient Horrors Asylum Pack
The Cards of Cthulhu
item.comment: A light but fun solo/co-op Cthulhu game. Gets a bit repetitive.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment:
Rating is for the base game. Add the Wizard's Tower and the rating skyrockets.
The base game is a very simple co-op that you can teach to neighbor kids. Add the expansion and the difficulty ratchets up several notches.

item.name: Caverna: The Cave Farmers
item.comment: Uwe's idea of fun is nothing like mine. I've yet to play a game of his that I've enjoyed.

item.name: City of Horror
item.comment: A total bomb with the boys. I'll have to use it at school with zombie crazy teens.

item.name: Clash of Wills: Shiloh 1862
item.comment: A very good update of the introductory game Test of Fire. More variety = more strategies to test.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment: Games don't get much better than this one: beautifully made, well designed and always a blast to play.

item.name: Claustrophobia: De Profundis
item.comment: Adds more variety to spice things up (especially for the demons) without destroying anything.

item.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game
item.comment:
Light fast-paced game. Can be played co-op or competitive.
Lots of back-and-forth take that in competitive mode.

item.name: Creatures & Cultists
item.comment:
Seems dated.
I hated Nuclear War with it's "I have a secret" right after drawing cards and C&C is just the same but with Mondos.
Takes longer than it should. But is mildly fun.

item.name: Cthulhu Dice
item.comment: Marek and Miles each have this as a gift from their cousin in America.

item.name: Dinosauriernas glömda dal
item.comment:
Swedish version: Dinosaurienas glömda dal.
Marek and Miles's

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment:
A hit!
This game is very fun to play and is my current favorite.
Chaotic and fun, this game really fells like the politics behind Anhk-Morpork. Trying to guess who is whom is very fun.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: We have to play without points until Miles and Saga get over losing.

item.name: Do You Worship Cthulhu?
item.comment:
I play this with my ESL classes (20-25 students). It's hard to get them talking, but they enjoy it.
I wish they had different pictures for the villagers.

item.name: Doctor Who Micro-Universe
item.comment: The only reason this doesn't get a 1 is because of the figures which can be used in better games. The "game" is nothing more Top Trumps with a die roll.

item.name: The Doctor Who Miniatures Game
item.comment: I printed these rules to play with the Micro-Universe figures. Since then I've supplemented with others (Black Tree and Crooked Dice) and rewritten the rules to fit H.P. Lovecraft's mythos (see Mythos Miniatures).

item.name: Doctor Who: Invasion Earth
item.comment: I'd rather play the Doctor Who Miniature Game.

item.name: Doctor Who: The Card Game
item.comment: A light fun game. Not really a "take that" game like people say here on BGG. Fun with some strategy but not a Wallace brain burner.

item.name: Dorn
item.comment: Diceless combat makes this one a bit of a brain-burner, as you have to think through all the consequences of a move, much like in chess and other abstracts.

item.name: Drako
item.comment:
Fun little filler with beautiful components.
It's not a very deep game, but you still need to think and plan in order to take advantage of opportunities when they arise.

item.name: Duel of Ages II
item.comment: Only played one learning scenario. Rating could go up or down after more plays.

item.name: Dungeon Command: Curse of Undeath
item.comment: Miles's

item.name: Dungeon Command: Tyranny of Goblins
item.comment: Marek's

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment:
Secret Santa 2011.
Good fun, but there are always more things to do each round than you have imps for. :-)
I think I enjoy Dungeon Petz more, because you can choose to split the imps into many groups or several big ones (to make sure you get what you want).
But this is still fun.

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment:
Marek's game.
This game is very fun. Being able to group imps and gold together to increase your chance of going first is a brilliant idea. Hidden bidding at its finest.
item.wishlistcomment:
Has shot up to #1 on the want list.
Marek seems in love with this game. With little Cthulie and other cuties, why shouldn't he?
Will probably get after Christmas

item.name: Dungeoneer: Vault of the Fiends
item.comment:
Starting to feel dated.
Wished it was co-op.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures Game (second edition)
item.comment: Not bad minis game. Too bad the minis are so expensive.
item.wishlistcomment: More D&D minis or Pathfinder Battles minis are always welcome. :-)

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment:
Meh. Fun but not WOW!
Plays more like Ghost Stories than like D&D.

item.name: Elder Sign
item.comment:
Very light and easy (too easy?) co-op.
Still I like to play it and the computer version.

item.name: Empires of the Ancient World
item.comment: Just won on e-Bay!

item.name: Fairy Tale
item.comment: I like this much more than 7 Wonders. You feel like you can affect the other players more, because you draft a hand of 5 cards and only play 3 of them. So you can take a chance and steal a worthless card for you but worth a lot to your neighbor.

item.name: Family Fluxx
item.comment: No strategy. Just chaos and fun.

item.name: Feudal
item.comment:
Can lead to AP when you try to plan the perfect assault.
Which would be right after you've finally manage to kill of the bloomin' archer.

item.name: A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment:
A great blend of wargame and deck builder.
Lowered rating, not because of the Halifax Hammer, but because I think I don't like deck builders.

item.name: Field of Glory: The Card Game
item.comment: Fun light war card game with a good bit of depth (for a light card game).

item.name: Fleet
item.comment: A rather boring light Euro. Race for the Galaxy, this game ain't.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: Too bad there are no monsters. The boys never want to play this.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: Don't get to play this as much as I'd like. The trip is not as fun as building the ship.

item.name: Gettysburg
item.comment:
#1295
This game is a very fun command puzzle. Management of command blocks and order discs are crucial to winning.
Lots of fun. Would love to play it more, but it takes up so much time (we spread it out over 3-4 days).

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment:
A hit with the boys.
I read a few of the low rated comments to get a feel why some people don't like this game. "Yatzhee I killed a ghost." "The die won the game." "No real decisions." "Too hard." "Frustrating when its hard to move and then fail on a dice roll." They are playing it wrong. The dice are just for "saving tokens".
This is resource management co-op. If you take on ghost without the corresponding tao-token, luck is your only hope. Share tokens (stand in the same spot as another taoist when exorcising) and stock up on token all the time.
My kids and I love playing this game. The dice add suspense, but don't make or break a game if you play with the right strategy.

item.name: Glen More
item.comment:
An fine game for a JABE (aka VP-fest).
You have to manage tiles, minion placement, and resources.

item.name: God's Playground
item.comment:
#218
I absolutely love this game, despite the fact that Miles always wins by taking either Ukraine or Lithuania (or both). I keep trying to take Greater Poland like a fool. :-(

item.name: Hacker
item.comment: Needs artwork.

item.name: Harry's Grand Slam Baseball Game
item.comment:
Fun, mindless baseball.
It's so mindless, Miles doesn't even get upset if he loses.

item.name: Hell Dorado
item.comment:
No time for painting and playing. :-(
This is a great minis game (if not one of the best).

item.name: Heroica: Fortaan
item.comment: Not bad for a Lego game. Needs a few house rules to make it more than meaningful.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment:
Deluxe version.
Saga's favorite game to play with me.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: Nifty little abstract.

item.name: The Hobbit
item.comment: May have to change the rating. We've been playing it wrong.

item.name: The Hobbit Card Game
item.comment:
One of Saga's Christmas presents 2012.
Surprisingly fun. You really need to think about when to win, which character should win and with which cards. The 2-player version eliminates (unless Bilbo dies after round 1) Thorin's horrible random ability. If people hate his ability, it should be easy to house rule it.

item.name: A House Divided: War Between the States 1861-65
item.comment: Marek's birthday present 2013.

item.name: Illuminati: Deluxe Edition
item.comment: My first "mature" board game? I think I played this before playing Battletech.

item.name: Incursion
item.comment: Space-hulk-esque game from a "better" company without the weird GW-setting. Instead you get Nazi-zombies and US-battle armor.

item.name: Kamisado
item.comment: Marek's birthday present 2012

item.name: Kapten Gold
item.comment:
Miles's and Saga's
For a small kids' game, this one is rather fun.

item.name: Kristallkoden
item.comment: Fun children's abstract.

item.name: Legendary Dungeoneer: Wrath of the Serpent Goddess
item.comment: Too much peril and glory, we often have in the forties. We just go around stomping on monsters until we get the big guns, then go in and try to kill the boss. Going up a level doesn't give you much, so there little incentive to complete quests.

item.name: Liberté
item.comment: If you like Wallace's historical games, you'll probably love this one.

item.name: London
item.comment:
Don't get to play as much as I'd like, since the kids don't like it much.
Minimal interaction, but still a fun game. Too bad it's not 1/2 an hour shorter.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lunch Money
item.comment: Fun with the right group.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: Commander Deck to play against the boys.

item.name: The Magnates: A Game of Power
Middle-Earth
item.comment: Marek's

item.name: Mission: Red Planet
item.comment: First play was a blast. To bad there is no official 2-player rules.

item.name: Monsterpocalypse
item.comment: Marek's, Miles's and mine (we each have a different army). The 2-player battle box is worth it!

item.name: Monsters Menace America
item.comment: Marek's

item.name: Munchkin Adventure Time
item.comment: For Miles and Saga — Christmas 2014

item.name: Munchkin Quest
item.comment:
Marek's
less interaction than normal Munchkin. Too many feet, so players' turns take too long.

item.name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game
item.comment:
Saga's
TS/AJ and R/RD theme decks.
Initial rating. A little too complicate for Saga (7). Bought Fluttershy & Pinkie Pie for myself to play until Saga can handle this game.

item.name: Mythos
item.comment: Maybe if I had more cards (just the Standard Set and 4 or 5 boosters) this game would be more fun. We just don't have enough monsters or combos.

item.name: Naruto Collectible Card Game
item.comment: My son has two starter decks. So far we've only played once to see how it plays. Seems okay, but without a lot of technique or tactic cards (maybe bad draws), the game boiled down to who could get the most ninjas first. Not a whole lot of strategy other than how to group the ninjas.
item.wishlistcomment: Marek's game. More cards would be welcomed, but they are hard to get over here.

item.name: Niagara
item.comment: Marek and Miles's

item.name: Nuclear War
item.comment: With the right group this game is a blast. Right now I mostly play it 2 player with my oldest son, it doesn't excel as a two-player game.

item.name: Okko, Era of the Karasu
item.comment: This is a must buy. It makes the base game exponentially better. Lots of improvements, while keeping the same basic rules and game play. Many of these things should have been included in the base game.

item.name: Okko: Era of the Asagiri
item.comment:
Don't let the low rating and complainers deter you, if you like the setting and tactical miniature games. Granted, without the big box expansion, this game is just a 6 for me. With Karasu it becomes a 7.5 or 8.
There are lots of interesting decisions to make, mostly on where to place your guys to get bonus and avoid "instant" death do to not being able to retreat or hazards when retreating.

item.name: Old Men of the Forest
item.comment: Underrated filler. Not great, but okay as a filler.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: Dark Tales
item.comment: Not dark enough

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Original Monchhichi at the Fair
item.comment: Roll and move.

item.name: P.I.
item.wishlistcomment: I will buy this when it comes out.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: After playing through the first 8 scenarios with Kyra (Marek), Harsk (Miles & me) and Seoni (me), I must say that this game despite being very simple is very addictive. Having a vested interest in your character's well being and equipment makes this game shine in campaign mode.

item.name: Perikles
item.comment: After first play, this game seems like a blast. A bit of a brain burner when deciding what to do with your forces, but still lots of fun. The dice rolling just adds suspense and surprise. Both are good things.

item.name: Pokémon Trading Figure Game
item.comment: Marek's and Miles's

item.name: Portobello Market
item.comment: Rather boring Euro. At least it is different than the engine building games.

item.name: Prophecy
item.comment:
Don't like the competitive aspect, as the ones who constantly get shut out of power-ups get cranky after 3 hours of play.
Hoping that the co-op rules in Dragon Realm revive my interest in this game. If not, I'll stick with Runebound since you are less mean to each other (true MPS).

item.name: Puerto Rico: Limited Anniversary Edition
item.comment: This should not have a separate edition. Beside PR is VERY over rated. ;-) Rating added because someone complained about people rating this edition a 1. Negative reinforcement.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: A fast (for 2 players) fun filler.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
item.comment:
Thanks BGG Secret Santa 2012!
:-)

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Rune Age
item.comment:
The lack of different cards doesn't matter, since the game events force you to do things (fire control) making it hard to buy more than a few different types anyways.
A very fun DB game with 4 different ways to play.

item.name: Rune Age: Oath and Anvil
item.comment: Great getting new factions and extra cards. The jury still isn't out on the new scenarios.

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment:
My first Wallace game.
Surprisingly fun. Very good solo/multiplayer solitaire game.

item.name: Sleeping Queens
item.comment: Saga's

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
item.comment:
Too brutally random. Winning requires LOTS of luck. It's also absolutely no fun to lose characters in the very first turn. Losing a team in the first turn can really put a damper on the entire game.
I've tried to like this game, but I don't. It's not fun, unless you get a string of lucky rolls, which doesn't often happen, so it usually seems more like torture than fun.

item.name: Space Infantry
item.comment:
Initial rating, based on how much fun we had in the first run through. Could change.
+s: Fast play, good variety, very tense -s: Lack of visual appeal, remembering to put the numbers back into the Random Number Generator (might try with the optional, "Use a Die" rule).

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment:
Fun, but not wee-woo! fun.
Scoring at the end is a bit too much.

item.name: Tannhäuser
item.comment:
This game is not as bad as all the 1st edition comments/reviews make it out to be.
It's a light and deadly skirmish game. We only play in story mode with scenarios. The video game modes don't do anything for me.

item.name: Test of Fire: Bull Run 1861
item.comment:
My first play against Marek (11) was fantastic. We were agonizing over every dice roll: not just attacks, but also orders at the end of the game. It went down to the wire.
Lots of fun. Very random, yes, but exciting and fun.
A great war game to play with kids.

item.name: Wings of War: Deluxe Set
item.comment: Marek and Miles's

item.name: Witch of Salem
item.comment:
This is just too hard and the thing that makes it hard is the random elements, so there is no why to improve your play. You have always maximize your efficiency and HOPE that you never get any bad luck. In order to win, you must have both.
This could be forgiven if the gameplay was fun (like in Ghost Stories), but it isn't simply because it is too Euroish (i.e., no special different special powers, board location power, etc.). Dry, dry, dry and boring.
However, it is very easy to house rule the game to make it a 7 or 8. That is what I have done (see Variants in the forum). One adds variable powers for players and board much like Ghost Stories. The other only adds some rules to make the game easier by limiting the power of the randomness and adding bonuses for doing good things, but still challenging.

item.name: The Witcher Adventure Game
item.comment: Prophecy, Runebound killer.

item.name: Wiz-War (eighth edition)
item.comment: A blast to play. Chaotic and fun.

item.name: Yggdrasil
item.comment: A great little co-op (not Ghost Stories great though). One of my favorite solo games. Good with my older son too.
